author: ryanleeschneider
content:
I noticed that the openRPC schema has `Integer` which is defined here: https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/blob/master/json-rpc/spec.json#L1788

But that doesn't fully enforce/encode the `QUANTITY` logic from the JSONRPC page: https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API

Namely the removal of leading zeroes (e.g. "0x3" vs "0x03").  Is `Integer` meant to be a superset of `QUANTITY` that also accepts leading zeroes or does it just need to be more strictly defined?

author: lightclient
content: I think it needs to be more strictly defined
